result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly Y Badgett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: -To count 3

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
 Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

-No contact with Metro Market
-No contact with Co- Actor, Brianna Wright. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:

-Sentence commencing on 10-21-2022 by 5:00pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Y Badgett

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;  filed by Atty. Priya Barnes

Case called at 2:57 p.m.
Attorney Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Kimberly Y Badgett. 
Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court. 
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.
Francis Lawrence, defendant's mother, makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  38 MONTHS
Initial Confinement: 14 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  24 MONTHS
Sentence to run Consecutive to Count 3.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No contact with: Metro Market 
No contact with :  co-actor, Brianna Wright

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $1,331.48 to be refunded to the poster.*

CONDITION TIME: 45-DAYS HUBER (Standard Release Conditions)
Sentence to commence on 10-21-22 by 5:00 p.m.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.

COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
90-DAYS JAIL
Credit time 6-days, if Revoked
Sentence to run Consecutive to Count 1.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No contact with: Metro Market 
No contact with :  co-actor, Brianna Wright

COSTS:  $243.00
DR GOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Case called at 12:06 PM
Attorney Andrea Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Kimberly Y Badgett.  
Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Counts 1 and 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Counts 1 and 3.
Counts 2, 4, and 5 are dismissed and read-in.
Court sets sentencing date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
dated 09-08-2022 from the State, requesting the 09-13-2022 Jury Trial be rescheduled
filed by the State

Jury status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Trial Scheduling Order signed by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III 06/16/2022.

10:24 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Barnes provides an update, she is requesting the matter be set for trial and should take 2 days.  Court will adjourn for jury status and jury trial, but will set the trial for 3 days incase.  Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:48 AM   File not called on the record.
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  
Attorney Barnes requests one more hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:23 AM Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty. Priya Barnes

01:20 PM Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Court orders the Defendant to call the SPD right now.

The Court recesses at 01:21 PM for the Defendant to call SPD.
The Court recalls the matter at 01:46 PM with the same appearances.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Metro Market/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:55 PM Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
